resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

comments.body:
gaolizhou opened a new pull request #1803: ARROW-2351 [C++] StringBuilder::append(vector<string>...) not impleme…
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1803
 
 
   changed the API from`Status Append(const std::vector<std::string>& values, uint8_t* null_bytes);` to  Status Append(const std::vector<std::string>& values); IMO, if string is empty, then it should be null, and vice versa.

cpcloud commented on issue #1803: ARROW-2351 [C++] StringBuilder::append(vector<string>...) not impleme…
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1803#issuecomment-377219210
 
 
   I don't think we can make a change like this. You need to be able to append a non null empty string. The fact that an empty string is what is at that memory location is an implementation detail.

wesm commented on a change in pull request #1803: ARROW-2351 [C++] StringBuilder::append(vector<string>...) not impleme…
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1803#discussion_r178207724
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/builder.cc
 ##########
 @@ -1385,6 +1385,28 @@ const uint8_t* BinaryBuilder::GetValue(int64_t i, int32_t* out_length) const {
 
 StringBuilder::StringBuilder(MemoryPool* pool) : BinaryBuilder(utf8(), pool) {}
 
+Status StringBuilder::Append(const std::vector<std::string>& values,
+                             uint8_t* null_bytes) {
+  std::size_t total_length = std::accumulate(
+      values.begin(), values.end(), 0ULL,
+      [](uint64_t sum, const std::string& str) { return sum + str.size(); });
 
 Review comment:
   Is using `std::accumulate` with a lambda the same speed as a for loop? 

----------------------------------------------------------------

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1803#issuecomment-378247469
 
 
   Sorry for my late comment.
   It may be better that we use `const uint8_t* valid_bytes` instead of `uint8_t* null_bytes`. Because other `Append` API use `const uint8_t* valid_bytes`.
